content.description:
A rather obscure route that for whatever reason is fun to climb. 5.7 climbing with a 5.9 crux. Climb to the 3rd bolt and then traverse into the crack.

NOTE: When lowering and cleaning, its recommended you leave the last draw in the first bolt and just lower to the ground. Then climb up and grab your draw. Otherwise both you and your belay will go for a Supertramp swing.
content.protection: 9 bolts and chain anchor (Longer Draws are best)
content.location: Around the corner from the pine tree landing. First route on the left.

content.description:
A deceptive route with an over hanging move or two giving it a 5.10 grade. the climbing is mostly 5.9 on super positive features.

First 2 bolts of climbing is still a bit dirty. Over time this should clean up to be a good one.
content.protection: 9 bolts and chain anchor. (Longer draws are best)
content.location: 2nd route around the corner from the pine tree landing. Right most route.
